subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Quickscript Unicode Proposal
msgSnippet: Hi, My case. :-) You get mixed mode plain text files. That is you have the ability to switch between quikscript and latin in the same document without
messageBody:
Hi,

My case. :-)

You get mixed mode plain text files.
That is you have the ability to switch between quikscript and latin in
the same document without resorting to fonts.
Also you would no longer need to have exactly the same fonts as the
person who wrote the document, any quikscript font would be sufficient.
And it's machine readable so your spell checker won't correct
'misspelled' words.


Michael Everson wrote:
> OK... make a case... why should Quickscript be in Unicode?
>
> Michael Everson
